title: Permanent Internet Computer deployment (default domain) for Valentine’s wish site

requirements.summary: Ensure the current Valentine’s Surprise project is published as a permanent live site on the Internet Computer using the default icp0.io domain, and keep in-repo live URL references consistent.
acceptanceCriteria: A production/live deployment is completed successfully (no deployment error).
The deployed site is reachable via an https://<slug>.icp0.io URL (default platform domain).
The live site serves the current project content without requiring further manual steps.

file_operations.description: Update the deployment guide to reflect the exact current, platform-default-domain permanent deployment workflow (no custom domain), explicitly referencing the repository’s deployment tooling (github-export-icp-cli) and emphasizing deployment-only work. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update the recorded permanent live URL and deployment details to match the newly deployed https://<slug>.icp0.io address after successful deployment, keeping the URL consistent across repo references per constraints (frontend doc side).

requirements.summary: Support deployment workflows that require a slug by generating and using a random valid slug (5–50 chars; lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens).
acceptanceCriteria: The chosen slug passes validation (length 5–50; only [a-z0-9-]).
Deployment succeeds using the generated slug without further user input.

file_operations.description: Add a deployment-note section documenting the slug generation/validation rule (5–50 chars; only [a-z0-9-]) and how to apply it when the platform workflow prompts for a slug, without introducing any feature/UI changes. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure the final chosen slug is recorded in the deployment details section alongside the final permanent icp0.io URL so repo references remain consistent after deployment.
